title: Determining the Orbit of an Asteroid

previous.title: Evaluating the Trend in Impact Probability

images.figText: Picture of the best-preserved meteorite crater on Earth, located in northern Arizona, United States. This meteorite impact crater measures approximately 3,900 ft (1,200 m) in diameter. Credit: Steve Jurvetson from Menlo Park, USA.

content:
Most often, newly discovered asteroids turn out to not be a threat to hit Earth. But Earthâ€™s geologic record reveals 128 impact craters that are 6 km in diameter or larger (and many more smaller ones), evidence that motivates us to continue to be on the lookout for possible impactors.

Here is an interactive map of some of the larger Earth impact craters that have been discovered.

question.title: Question #1
question.label: Find the impact crater nearest you. What is its name and location?

question.title: Question #1
question.label: What is the diameter of the crater? What is its age (how long ago did the impact occur)?
